com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.string.joiner.formatter
Class CountingStringFormatter

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.string.joiner.formatter.AbstractStringFormatter
      com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.string.joiner.formatter.CountingStringFormatter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Formatter2
@FullyTested
public final class CountingStringFormatter
extends AbstractStringFormatter
implements Formatter2

Formats a value using String.format() with an incrementing counter. Unlike StringFormatter, this class has state. The next count is stored internally. Be careful when reusing instances of this class.

Author:
Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)
See Also:
AbstractStringFormatter, Formatter2

Field Detail

DEFAULT_FIRST_COUNT

public static final int DEFAULT_FIRST_COUNT
Default value for first count. Override the default using withFirstCount(int).

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

CountingStringFormatter

public CountingStringFormatter(String format,
                               Formatter2 formatter)
Creates a new two phase formatter with a format string.
  1. Use formatter to convert a value to string
  2. Call String.format(String, Object...) with format, current count, and result from previous step

To modify the default first count, see withFirstCount(int).

Example: new CountingStringFormatter("%d) %s", new PathFormatter())

Parameters:
format -
  • Format string for String.format(String, Object...)
  • Must not be null, empty, or only whitespace
  • Must have at least one "%d" and one "%s" token
  • Example: "%d: [%s]"
formatter - used in step 1 to format each value
Throws:
NullPointerException - if format or formatter is null
IllegalArgumentException - if format is empty or only whitespace
See Also:
DEFAULT_FIRST_COUNT, withFirstCount(int), Formatter
Method Detail

withFirstCount

public CountingStringFormatter withFirstCount(int firstCount)
Constructs a new instance with new first count.

Parameters:
firstCount - first count used during formatting, e.g., 0, 1, 100, etc.
Returns:
new instance with new first count
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if this method is called after format(Object)
See Also:

public String format(Object value)
